alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 1:22PM AKST until March 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Blowing snow reducing visibility to one half mile or less at times over highway summits north of Fairbanks. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches from Fairbanks north, with 4 to 7 inches of snow expected south of Fairbanks. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow over highway summits north of Fairbanks through 6 AM Friday morning. Expect 2 to 4 inches of snow from Fairbanks north, and 4 to 7 inches of snow south of Fairbanks. Snow is expected to diminish Thursday evening in the Fairbanks area and Thursday night south of Fairbanks. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
